triples.name: Extravehicular activity
triples.relevance: EVA mission planning is the core task that the paper addresses for autonomous decision support in space exploration.

triples.name: Retrieval-augmented generation
triples.relevance: RAG is a key method used to augment the LLM with domain-specific knowledge from the EVA knowledge base.

triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs form the foundation of the AI system for natural language understanding and generation of EVA plans.

triples.name: FAISS
triples.relevance: FAISS is used as the similarity search engine powering the retrieval component of the knowledge base.

triples.name: A* search algorithm
triples.relevance: A* path planning is used to generate optimal EVA routes considering terrain and obstacles in the environment.

triples.name: Metabolism
triples.relevance: Metabolic models are used to predict crew energy expenditure and safety margins during EVA missions.

triples.name: Computer simulation
triples.relevance: Physical simulation models are used to model gravity conditions and environmental constraints for EVA planning.

triples.name: Intelligent agent
triples.relevance: Agentic orchestration layer coordinates autonomous decision-making for mission planning and execution.

triples.name: Deep space exploration
triples.relevance: The paper targets Earth-independent AI systems specifically for deep-space exploration missions beyond Earth orbit.

triples.name: Retrieval Augmented Generation systems
triples.relevance: The paper proposes RASAGE, a novel intelligent agent system for autonomous EVA mission planning that combines retrieval, simulation, and planning.
